text: Third-seeded Alice Marble defeated first-seeded Helen Jacobs 4–6, 6–3, 6–2 in the final to win the Women's Singles tennis title at the 1936 U.S. National Championships. The tournament was played on outdoor grass courts and held from September 3, through September 12, 1936 at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens, New York. The draw consisted of 64 players of which eight were seeded. ==Seeds== The eight seeded U.S. players are listed below. Alice Marble is the champion; others show in brackets the round in which they were eliminated. # Helen Jacobs (Finalist) # Sarah Fabyan (First round) # Alice Marble (Champion) # Carolin Babcock (Quarterfinalist) # Marjorie Van Ryn (Third round) # Gracyn Wheeler (Quarterfinalist) # Helen Pedersen (Semifinalist) # Mary Greef Harris (Third round) ==Draw== ===Final eight=== ==References== Category:U.S. National Championships (tennis) by year – Women's Singles Category:1936 in women's tennis Category:1936 in American women's sports Category:1936 U.S. National Championships (tennis)
title: 1936 U.S. National Championships – Women's Singles
